Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: I don't need him to be charming. I need him to turn this bunch of thieves and runaways into men of the Night's Watch.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Slowly. A raven came for Ned Stark's son.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Both.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: We've been capturing wildlings, more every month. They're fleeing south. The ones who flee... say they've seen the White Walkers.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: One of our own rangers swore he saw them kill his companions. He swore it right up to the moment Ned Stark chopped his head off.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Your sister sits by the side of the King. Tell her we need help.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Here you begin anew.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: You'll want to take your vow before a heart tree as your Uncle did.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: You'll find a Weirwood a mile North of the Wall. And your old Gods too, maybe.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Does house Tarly keep the old Gods?

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: As you wish, lad.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: It's Othor, without a doubt.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Any sign of Benjen or the rest of his party?

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Mmm.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: I want Maester Aemon to examine them first.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Bring me a horn of ale, Snow, and pour one for yourself.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Sit.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: I hope you're not thinking of doing anything stupid.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: I'm sure they'll be treated gently.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: When does Aemon think you'll be able to use that hand?

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Good. You'll be ready for this, then. l thought a wolf was more appropriate for you than a bear so l had a new pommel made. lt's called Longclaw. Works as well for a wolf as a bear, l think.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: lt was my father's sword, his father before him. The Mormonts have carried it for five centuries. lt was meant for my son Jorah. He brought dishonor to our House, but he had the grace to leave the sword before he fled from Westeros.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Oh, you can. And you will. l wouldn't be standing here if it wasn't for you and your beast. A bloody dead man tried to kill me, so you'll take it. l'll hear no more about it. ls that understood?

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Right. Now, don't think this means l approve of this nonsense with you and Alliser Thorne. That's a man's sword. lt'll take a man to wield it.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: No, you won't. l sent him to King's Landing yesterday. The hand that your wolf tore off that thing's wrist â€“ l've ordered Thorne to lay it at the feet of this boy king. That should get young Joffrey's attention. And it, uh, puts a thousand leagues between you and Thorne. Now go and put your sword somewhere safe and bring me my supper.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Ham. How many days in a row must a man be expected to start his day with ham? Bring me some beer at least. You look exhausted. Was your moonlight ride that tiring?

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: l didn't say it was your honor.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: And you're gonna bring him back to life, are you? No? Good. We've had enough of that sort of thing. Beyond the Wall, the Rangers are reporting whole villages abandoned. At night they see fires blazing in the mountains from dusk until dawn. A captured wildling swears their tribes are uniting in some secret stronghold, to what ends the gods only know. Outside Eastwatch Cotter Pyke's men discovered four blue-eyed corpses. Unlike us, they were wise enough to burn them. Do you think your brother's war is more important than ours?

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: When dead men and worse come hunting for us in the night, do you think it matters who sits on the lron Throne?

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: Good. Because l want you and your wolf with us when we ride out beyond the Wall tomorrow.

Name: jeor mormont
Sentence: l'll not sit meekly by and wait for the snows. l mean to find out what's happening. The Night's Watch will ride in force against the wildlings, the White Walkers and whatever else is out there. And we will find Benjen Stark, alive or dead. l will command them myself. So l'll only ask you once, Lord Snow, are you a brother of the Night's Watch or a bastard boy who wants to play at war?
